action.name: im Uhrzeigersinn drehen
action.command: set -e;AMOUNT=$(for file in %F;do echo $file;done | wc -l);NR=0;for file in %F;do NR=$(echo "$NR+1" | bc); echo "#"$(basename "$file"); echo $(echo "$NR*100/$AMOUNT" | bc); filetmp=$(dirname "$file")/.$(basename "$file").tmp; convert -rotate 90 $file $filetmp 2>/dev/null >/dev/null; cp "$filetmp" "$file"; rm "$filetmp";done |zenity --progress --auto-close;

action.name: gegen den Uhrzeigersinn drehen
action.command: set -e;AMOUNT=$(for file in %F;do echo $file;done | wc -l);NR=0;for file in %F;do NR=$(echo "$NR+1" | bc); echo "#"$(basename "$file"); echo $(echo "$NR*100/$AMOUNT" | bc); filetmp=$(dirname "$file")/.$(basename "$file").tmp; convert -rotate 270 $file $filetmp 2>/dev/null >/dev/null; cp "$filetmp" "$file"; rm "$filetmp";done |zenity --progress --auto-close;
action.description: Markierte Bilder werden gegen den Uhrzeigersinn gedreht
